page.title: 05FARMING IN RUNCORN
page.content: Until the mid 1950's Runcorn's industry consisted of chemicals, leather and farming.Only the chemical industry survived and flourished. Farming today is on a continually reduced scale,due to land being built on for housing,transport and industry. Much of the farm land was lost to the new town development in the 1960's. Several farms have been demolished but those remaining are typical of 19th. century Cheshire farming _ dairy, arable and poultry farming. Such farms, though few in number and small in size are to be found on the outskirts of Runcorn. There are small herds of dairy cattle;hens reared for eggs; wheat,barley,oats and potatoes, are the main crops.But some of the land is grassed to provide silage/hay.
